intro: Weinmannia hypoglauca, commonly known as the silverleaf weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense covering of fine hairs. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Weinmannia hypoglauca produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are visited by various pollinators.
